Metadata.Name: DNA Order
Metadata.Summary: The DNA Order IEPD was developed for the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project.
Metadata.Description: A DNA Order is an order sent from the Court to the jail to collect DNA from a subject. The DNA Order contains information about a subject such as case number, booking number, state identification number, location of the DNA collection site, and signature block. The DNA Order is one of 44 IEPDs developed by the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project to support information exchange between state and local government organizations throughout the state of California. It could also be adapted for use in other states.
Metadata.Status: IEPD DNAOrder complete and ready for implementation
Metadata.ExchangePartners: California state and local criminal justice agencies
Metadata.Process: The Court sends an order to the jail to collect DNA from a subject.
Metadata.Conditions: If the Court orders the collection of a DNA sample and the subject has been convicted then an order is sent to the jail to collect the DNA sample. Conditions may change depending upon new Legislation.
Metadata.Sponsors: California Department of Justice and other California state and local criminal justice agencies - see master documentation
Metadata.Purpose: Allows the Court to inform the jail when a DNA sample is required of a subject.
Metadata.ExchangePartnerCategories: California state and local criminal justice agencies
